sense.name: a rule or principle
sense.commentary: Some rule, either external or internal, that governs behavior or the state of things.
sense.examples: According to official regulations, the kick was out-of-bounds. A number of new regulations determined John's salary. Short hair is the regulation around here.

sense.name: state of being under control
sense.commentary: REGULATION[+event] The state of being governed or under control. Being well-regulated.
sense.examples: Military school will give your life some regulation, boy. Regulation and organization are the keys to our department's success.

sense.name: act of managing
sense.commentary: REGULATION[+event] Refers to the act of governing or controlling something. The act of regulating.
sense.examples: The regulation of the airwaves is the SCC's job. The rebels refused to submit to the government's regulation.

sense.name: making regular or uniform
sense.commentary: REGULATION[+event] The act of organizing or regularizing something. Probably called regularization most of the time.
sense.examples: The regulation of our messy waste-disposal system was one of my early achievements.

sense.name: ability to heal an injury
sense.commentary: Embryos have an ability to continue normal development after its structure has been damaged.
sense.examples: If we harnessed an embryo's power of regulation, perhaps we could normalize our cell structures!
